Author: Ren√© Locher
Review: Die App ist leicht bedienbar und informativ. Leider ist Android 10 bei der Vergabe der Berechtigungen zu wenig spezifisch, so dass man das GPS einschalten muss, damit die App funktioniert, obwohl die App GPS gar nicht braucht. Daf√ºr ist aber nicht die App sondern Google verantwortlich. Obwohl ich vor dem Gebrauch dieser App das GPS nie eingeschaltet hatte, l√§uft aber mein Pixel 4 nun mit eingeschaltetem GPS und dieser App im Hintergrund nicht merkbar weniger lang! Die App ist in Sachen Datenschutz so sicher und transparent wie sie sein kann. Das wird auch von unabh√§ngigen Experten best√§tigt. Klickt auf "weitere Informationen" im Google Store und ihr bekommt eine detaillierte Beschreibung dar√ºber, wie die App funktioniert. Es gibt also keine vern√ºnftigen Ausreden, sie nicht zu ben√ºtzen! Allerdings habe ich trotzdem noch einen Wunsch an die App-Entwickler: Baut doch noch in die App ein Infofenster ein, in welchem die Anzahl t√§glicher Kontakte der App als Zeitreihe eingetragen wird. Damit k√∂nnte man sein eigenes Verhalten in Bezug auf Distanzhalten √ºberpr√ºfen und gegebenenfalls optimieren.
Title Review: The app is easy to use and informative. Unfortunately  Android 10 is not specific enough when it comes to assigning permissions  so you have to switch on the GPS for the app to work  even though the app doesn't need GPS at all. But Google is not responsible for this  but not the app. Although I had never switched on the GPS before using this app  my Pixel 4 now runs not noticeably less long with the GPS switched on and this app in the background! When it comes to data protection  the app is as secure and transparent as it can be. This is also confirmed by independent experts. Click on "more information" in the Google Store and you will get a detailed description of how the app works. So there are no reasonable excuses not to use them! However  I still have a request for the app developers: Build an information window in the app in which the number of daily contacts of the app is entered as a time series. This would allow you to check your own behavior with regard to keeping your distance and optimize it if necessary.
content: The app is easy to use and informative  Unfortunately  Android    is not specific enough when it comes to assigning permissions  so you have to switch on the GPS for the app to work  even though the app doesn t need GPS at all  But Google is not responsible for this  but not the app  Although I had never switched on the GPS before using this app  my Pixel   now runs not noticeably less long with the GPS switched on and this app in the background  When it comes to data protection  the app is as secure and transparent as it can be  This is also confirmed by independent experts  Click on  more information  in the Google Store and you will get a detailed description of how the app works  So there are no reasonable excuses not to use them  However  I still have a request for the app developers  Build an information window in the app in which the number of daily contacts of the app is entered as a time series  This would allow you to check your own behavior with regard to keeping your distance and optimize it if necessary

Author: Hans-Peter Korn
Review: Google verlangt bei BLE-beacons aus kommerziellen (nicht technischen) Gr√ºnden die Standortfreigabe um den Standort laufend u.a. zwecks ortsabh√§ngiger Werbung zu erhalten. Das will ich nicht erlauben. Ich aktiviere den Standort nur selten, wenn ich ihn brauche. Leider beruht das Prinzip der App auf der bereits √ºberholten Annahme, dass ALLE Infizierten andere anstecken k√∂nnen. Heute wei√ü man, dass prim√§r nur WENIGE "Superspreader" sehr viele andere anstecken. Diese Superspreader kann die App nicht erkennen. Die meisten Infizierten jedoch stecken nur sehr wenige an. Dennoch werden alle Kontakte eines Infizierten in Quarant√§ne geschickt - zu √ºber 99.5 % sind sie aber nicht infiziert, die Quarant√§ne ist also v√∂llig √ºbertrieben. Diese App ist somit sozial und wirtschaftlich sch√§dlich!
Title Review: For commercial (non-technical) reasons  Google requires BLE beacons to be continuously approved for their location  among other things. for the purpose of location-based advertising. I don't want to allow that. I rarely activate the location when I need it. Unfortunately  the principle of the app is based on the already outdated assumption that ALL infected people can infect others. Today we know that primarily only a FEW "super spreaders" infect many others. The app cannot recognize these super spreaders. Most infected people  however  only infect very few. Nevertheless  all contacts of an infected person are quarantined - but over 99.5% of them are not infected  so the quarantine is completely exaggerated. This app is therefore socially and economically harmful!

Author: Nicolas Leuenberger
Review: Tourne de fa√ßon transparente et sans impact visible sur l'autonomie (Galaxy S10). - Pour ceux qui se plaignent de devoir activer la localisation ou de perdre en autonomie: Oui il faut donner acc√®s √† la position sous Android pour que le Bluetooth LE puisse scanner. Ca ne veut pas dire que cette info est utilis√©e par SwissCovid. Oui c'est chiant, mais c'est Google qu'il faut bl√¢mer pour √ßa, pas SwissCovid. - Si votre batterie se vide, allez voir dans les param√®tres quelles applications ont acc√®s √† la localisation et d√©sactivez l'acc√®s pour celles qui ne sont pas cens√©es avoir besoin de ce param√®tre. Ou donnez acc√®s que durant l'utilisation. - Si vous ne pouvez pas l'installer car vous avez une version d'Android plus ancienne que la 6.0, pensez s√©rieusement √† t√©l√©charger les mises √† jours ou si elles ne sont pas dispos, envisagez de changer de smartphone. S√©rieusement, les failles de s√©curit√©s pr√©sentes dans des versions aussi anciennes d'Android vous exposent √† des ennuis r√©els.
Title Review: Runs transparently and with no visible impact on battery life (Galaxy S10). - For those who complain of having to activate the location or of losing autonomy: Yes  you must give access to the position under Android so that the Bluetooth LE can scan. This does not mean that this info is used by SwissCovid. Yes it's boring  but it's Google to blame for that  not SwissCovid. - If your battery drains  go to the settings to see which applications have access to the location and disable access for those that are not supposed to need this setting. Or give access only during use. - If you cannot install it because you have a version of Android older than 6.0  seriously consider downloading the updates or if they are not available  consider changing your smartphone. Seriously  the security holes in such old versions of Android leave you in real trouble.

Author: Andy M√ºller
Review: Die Datenschutzrichtlinien sind sehr Umfangreich. Jedoch verstehe ich immer noch nicht, wie informiert werden kann, wenn die Daten nicht irgendwo Zentral gesammelt (oder Dezentral, mir doch egal. gesammelt ist gesammelt) werden. Das Smartphone kann nicht selbst andere informieren. Vor allem nicht, wenn man sich gem√§ss Empfehlung in Quarant√§ne begibt. Irgendwo muss es eine Datenbank aller IDs geben welche noch weitere Informationen enth√§lt. Z.B. ob und wann man positiv getestet wurde. Was wird alles genau gesammelt? Gem√§ss Datenschutz "weder Standortdaten noch Daten √ºber Ihre Identit√§t". Doch wie sieht es um das Smartphone aus? Typ? OS? Natelnummer? Ich m√∂chte wisses was gesammel wird, nicht was nicht gesammelt wird. Hierzu gibt es leider keine genauen Angaben. Ich benutze die App doch bin ich ihr immer noch sehr, sehr skeptisch gegen√ºber da mir wichtige Informationen fehlen. Der soziale Druck um mich herum ist jedoch zu hoch, sie nicht einzusetzen.
Title Review: The data protection guidelines are very extensive. However  I still don't understand how information can be provided if the data is not collected centrally somewhere (or decentralized  I don't care. Is collected). The smartphone itself cannot inform others. Especially not if you go into quarantine as recommended. There has to be a database of all IDs somewhere which contains further information. E.g. if and when you tested positive. What exactly is collected? According to data protection "neither location data nor data about your identity". But what about the smartphone? Type? OS? Mobile number? I want to know what is being collected  not what is not being collected. Unfortunately  there is no precise information on this. I use the app but I am still very  very skeptical about it because I am missing important information. However  the social pressure around me is too high not to use them.
content: The data protection guidelines are very extensive  However  I still don t understand how information can be provided if the data is not collected centrally somewhere  or decentralized  I don t care  Is collected   The smartphone itself cannot inform others  Especially not if you go into quarantine as recommended  There has to be a database of all IDs somewhere which contains further information  E g  if and when you tested positive  What exactly is collected  According to data protection  neither location data nor data about your identity   But what about the smartphone  Type  OS  Mobile number  I want to know what is being collected  not what is not being collected  Unfortunately  there is no precise information on this  I use the app but I am still very  very skeptical about it because I am missing important information  However  the social pressure around me is too high not to use them

Author: Francesco Antognini
Review: Second thought. The location issue is bad. However it's not solvable, at least for now. Unlike many here are saying it's not a permission issue. The app doesn't even ask for fine location permission. It's a design decision by google. When an app gets a list of nearby devices (wifi, bt, etc) it could use it to find the actual position of the phone. Therefore if user disables location services from the settings, listing of nearby devices (wifi, bt,..) will be disabled for all apps regardless of permission settings. As a result the covid app which is based on finding nearby and unknown devices, needs location services enabled. Mitigating factors. Try location with battery saving enabled. Disable all notification from the covid app and enable location services only when a lot of people are nearby. Also battery management is problematic. Uninstalled.
Title Review: Second thought. The location issue is bad. However it's not solvable  at least for now. Unlike many here are saying it's not a permission issue. The app doesn't even ask for fine location permission. It's a design decision by google. When an app gets a list of nearby devices (wifi  bt  etc) it could use it to find the actual position of the phone. Therefore if user disables location services from the settings  listing of nearby devices (wifi  bt ..) will be disabled for all apps regardless of permission settings. As a result the covid app which is based on finding nearby and unknown devices  needs location services enabled. Mitigating factors. Try location with battery saving enabled. Disable all notification from the covid app and enable location services only when a lot of people are nearby. Also battery management is problematic. Uninstalled.

syn: locat, disabl, servic, servic, manag, manag, locat, factor

Author: Ronald Rueff
Review: gut gemeint und schlecht gemacht - ich sehe keinen grund, weshalb ich f√ºr eine standortneutrale app die standortermittlung aktiviert haben sollte - zudem ben√∂tigt diese ebenfalls zus√§tzlich akku. dass die app m√∂glicherweise keine berechtigung f√ºr standortdaten ben√∂tigt, macht die sache nicht besser, solange gps aktiv sein muss. gps wird ja m√∂glicherweise nur von google als generelles android feature genutzt - z.b. f√ºr noch bessere navi/traffic-daten, doch wenn man gps ausschaltet, funktioniert swisscovid nicht mehr. erinnert mich irgendwie an ein restaurant-angebot: heute schnitzel f√ºr chf 1.- (brot dazu obligatorisch chf 20.-)
Title Review: Well meant and badly done - I see no reason why I should have activated location detection for a location-neutral app - it also requires an additional battery. the fact that the app may not need authorization for location data doesn't make things any better as long as gps has to be active. gps is possibly only used by google as a general android feature - e.g. for even better navi / traffic data  but if you switch off gps  swisscovid no longer works. Somehow reminds me of a restaurant offer: today schnitzel for CHF 1.- (bread compulsory CHF 20.-)
content: Well meant and badly done   I see no reason why I should have activated location detection for a location neutral app   it also requires an additional battery  the fact that the app may not need authorization for location data doesn t make things any better as long as gps has to be active  gps is possibly only used by google as a general android feature   e g  for even better navi   traffic data  but if you switch off gps  swisscovid no longer works  Somehow reminds me of a restaurant offer  today schnitzel for CHF      bread compulsory CHF

Author: Jeremy Mion
Review: Great app. I have read a few comments from concerned users about needing to have location services enabled on Android. This doesn't mean that the app is using GPS, or tracking your location. It is a limitation of Google Android Software development tools that force the developers to ask for location permission. If you have a look at the code of the app it becomes obvious that GPS is not used. Trust us computer scientists that know what is going on. No degredation in battery performance noticed.

Author: Chris Ron
Review: Installation erst im zweiten Anlauf. Die Antwortzeit beim Download war zu lang. Unsch√∂n aber eigentlich der Fehler von Google, man kann die Nutzung von Bluetooth nicht granular regeln. Mit aktivem BT kann im Grunde jede andere App welche BT f√§hig ist BT nutze. 2. Ob Googles Schuld oder die App, entgegen der offiziellen Aussage, ist GPS zwingend und kann nicht ausgeschaltet werden. Gut f√ºr Qualit√§t Distanzmessung und reduziert Hacking Angriffsfl√§che aber schaft nicht gerade Vertrauen.
Title Review: Installation only at the second attempt. The download response time was too long. Unpleasant but actually the mistake of Google  you cannot regulate the use of Bluetooth granularly. With active BT  basically every other app that is BT capable can use BT. 2. Whether Google's fault or the app  contrary to the official statement  GPS is mandatory and cannot be switched off. Good for quality distance measurement and reduces hacking attack surface but not exactly trust.
content: Installation only at the second attempt  The download response time was too long  Unpleasant but actually the mistake of Google  you cannot regulate the use of Bluetooth granularly  With active BT  basically every other app that is BT capable can use BT     Whether Google s fault or the app  contrary to the official statement  GPS is mandatory and cannot be switched off  Good for quality distance measurement and reduces hacking attack surface but not exactly trust

Author: Robin Hilber
Review: Warum GPS bzw. Locationdata eingeschaltet sind: Unter Android ist es nicht (mehr) m√∂glich aus der App nur die Bluetooth oder Wlan Berechtigung anzufordern, es muss gleichzeitig immer auch die Standort Berechtigung gegeben werden. Das hat damit zu tun, dass mittels Bluetooth/Wlan alleine schon eine Standortbestimmung m√∂glich ist, was vielen Benutzern nicht bewusst ist. Deshalb sind die Berechtigungen nur im Doppelpack verf√ºgbar. Verwendet werden aber die Standortdaten nicht.
Title Review: Why GPS or location data are switched on: Under Android  it is no longer possible to request only Bluetooth or WiFi authorization from the app; the location authorization must always be given at the same time. This has to do with the fact that a location can be determined using Bluetooth / WiFi  which many users are not aware of. Therefore the authorizations are only available in a double pack. However  the location data is not used.
content: Why GPS or location data are switched on  Under Android  it is no longer possible to request only Bluetooth or WiFi authorization from the app  the location authorization must always be given at the same time  This has to do with the fact that a location can be determined using Bluetooth   WiFi  which many users are not aware of  Therefore the authorizations are only available in a double pack  However  the location data is not used
